content: अनुनी {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To conciliate, win over, induce, persuade, prevail upon; request, supplicate, entreat, propitiate, pacify, appease (anger &c.); स चानुनीतः प्रणतेन पश्चात् <ls>R. 5. 54</ls>; विग्रहाच्च शयने पराङ्मुखीर्नानुनेतुमबलाः स तत्वरे <ls n="R.">19. 38</ls>, <ls n="R. 19.">43</ls>; <ls>Bk. 6. 137</ls>; <ls n="Bk.">5. 46</ls>, त्वत्संगमेन मम तत्तदिवानुनीतं <ls>V. 3. 20</ls> pacified, made favourable or agreeable; <ls>Ki. 13. 67</ls>; <ls>M. 5</ls>; <ls>K. 168</ls>, <ls n="K.">178</ls>; <ls>Dk. 3</ls>, <ls n="Dk.">4</ls>, <ls n="Dk.">7.</ls> {@--2@} To cherish love; विद्विषोप्यनुनय <ls>Bh. 2. 77</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> Shakespeare “Cherish those hearts that hate thee”. {@--3@} To bring near to (with <ab>dat.</ab> of person). {@--4@} To train, discipline. {@--5@} To honour.
